meanings.definition: To make something common or ordinary.
meanings.sent1: Using too much slang vulgarises the conversation.
meanings.sent2: The fast-food chain vulgarises the idea of a home-cooked meal.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to wear a tie with pajamas vulgarises the formal dress code.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist vulgarises the pristine walls with colorful tags.
meanings.sent5: The reality TV show vulgarises the concept of true love.

meanings.definition: To make something crude or indecent.
meanings.sent1: Adding inappropriate jokes vulgarises the comedy show.
meanings.sent2: The explicit lyrics vulgarises the song's message.
meanings.sent3: The prankster vulgarises the office environment with silly pranks.
meanings.sent4: The scandalous gossip vulgarises the peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The revealing outfit vulgarises the formal event.
